definition: to spread/to lay out/to apply (powder, ointment etc)/sufficient (to cover)/enough
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known

sentences.english: Instead , apply warm compresses to the neck , chest wall and groin.
sentences.chinese: 應該使用熱的敷布敷在患者的胸部與腹股溝部。

sentences.english: Change compresses every five minutes to ensure fresh Hyamine is in contact with the skin.
sentences.chinese: 每5分鐘換一次敷布，以確保季銨鹽接觸到皮膚。

sentences.english: If soaking is impractical, soaks or compresses maybe used.
sentences.chinese: 如果無法浸泡，可以用浸布或敷布。

definition: bodily fluids (general term in Chinese medicine)
bladder 氣|气[qi4] transformation in TCM
(TCM) the three truncal cavities (thoracic, abdominal and pelvic), known as the "triple heater" or "San Jiao"

(TCM) six bowels (hollow organs), namely: gall bladder 膽|胆[dan3], stomach 胃[wei4], large intestine 大腸|大肠[da4 chang2], small intestine 小腸|小肠[xiao3 chang2], triple heater 三焦[san1 jiao1], bladder 膀胱[pang2 guang1]
five viscera of TCM, namely: heart 心[xin1], liver 肝[gan1], spleen 脾[pi2], lungs 肺[fei4] and kidneys 腎|肾[shen4]
(in Chinese medicine) stasis (of blood or other fluids)
qi and blood (two basic bodily fluids of Chinese medicine)
pathogeny (cause of disease) in TCM/as opposed to vital energy 正氣|正气[zheng4 qi4]
